name: group_pf9ew33
label: PSA Farm Interview

name: form_name
label: Form Name

name: form_version
label: Version

name: note1
label: Welcome Field Technicians--   Thank you for taking the time to complete this survey with each of your growers.  This data will help us understand patterns across a variety of demographic and contextual variables. We could not do this work without you!

name: new
label: Are you new to this survey? We have a few instructions...

name: nav_note
label: SURVEY NAVIGATION -- Swipe left to see a new question.   Inside a "Group" of questions, scroll up and down.  If you arrive at the end of a Group, and are not prompted, swipe left to continue to a new section.  To navigate to the beginning or end of a survey click ARROW WITH THE DOT at the top right corner of the screen.

name: survey_note
label: SURVEY FORMAT -- This survey can be done over the phone or in-person, but you will need to schedule dedicated time to talk through these questions.    The survey should take around 30 minutes to complete.

name: group1_note
label: Group 1: Technician and Farmer Contact Info  [Q 1 to Q 7] --general contact information and can be completed PRIOR to sitting down with the grower.

name: group2_note
label: Group 2: General Farm Management  [Q 8 to Q 27 ]-- these questions target the ENTIRE farm operation, and will be used by our Social Science and Economics Teams.

name: group3_note
label: GROUP 3: PSA Site Specific Questions [Q 28 to 48] -- this group is specific to the trial field history and management.  If a grower has multiple trial fields, the survey will automatically prompt you to enter data for the additional fields; thus you only need to complete ONE survey per grower.

name: save_note
label: EXITING and SAVING -- You may save and exit the survey form at any point during. If there are required fields, it may ask you to fill those before saving. Saved forms will be stored on your device within the KoBoCollect App and can be edited at any time by clicking "Edit Saved Forms" in the main menu.  However, once a form has been uploaded (by selecting "Send Finalized Form"  in the main menu), it can no longer be edited. To Save, Click the Arrow with the Dot in the Right Corner.

name: begin_note
label: Before You Begin -- You will need to know the 3-letter trial code(s) associated with each trial field.      Swipe left for the first group of questions.

name: group_ct2kn52
label: Group 1: Technician and Farmer Contact Information

name: state
label: 1. State farm is located [please enter the two-letter abbreviation for your state, example: NC]

name: tech
label: 2. Field tech last name

name: tech_phone
label: 3. Field tech phone number

name: tech_email
label: 4. Field tech email

name: grower_last_name
label: 5. Grower last name

name: grower_phone
label: 6. Grower phone number

name: grower_email
label: 7. Grower email

name: farm_or_station
label: Is this a farm or research station? (If this is a research station, you will skip the farmer interview portion and go directly to site history information.)

name: group_social_sci_survey
label: Group 2: General Whole Farm Survey

name: crop_acres
label: 8. As of today, how many total acres do you plant in crops? [acres]

name: farm_crop_rotation
label: 9. What crops are GENERALLY in your crop rotation?

name: cover_crop_acres
label: 10. As of today, how many of your total cropped acres are in COVER CROPS? [acres]

name: cover_crop_acres_terminated
label: 10.a Clarification:  If COVER CROPS have already been terminated, how many acres did you have of winter cover crops prior to termination? [# acres, or leave blank if not applicable]

name: cover_crop_acres_typical
label: 11.  If this was a particularly bad or otherwise non-representative year, how many acres do you typically have of winter COVER CROPS?  [# acres, or leave blank if not applicable]

name: first_year_cover_crop
label: 12. In what year did you first plant COVER CROPS? [four digit year, example : 1985] *reminder, for a grower to participate, this may not be their first time planting cover crops

name: every_year
label: 13. Have you planted COVER CROPS every consecutive year since?

name: cover_crop_rotation
label: 13 a. If no, describe your cover crop rotation.

name: favorite_cover_crop
label: 14. Do you have a favorite cover crop?

name: favorite_winter_cover_crop
label: 14a. Which is your favorite? (winter cover crop)

name: insured_acres
label: 15. As of today, how many of your total cropped acres are enrolled in crop insurance? [acres]

name: removed_insurance
label: 16. Have you removed crop insurance on any of your fields due to cover cropping?

name: if_yes_remove_insurance_note
label: 16.a  If you selected "Yes," please provide additional details.

name: claim_cover_crop
label: 17.  Have you ever had problems filing a crop insurance claim because of using cover crops?

name: if_yes_claim_note
label: 17.a  If you selected "Yes," please provide additional details.

name: tilled_acres
label: 18. As of today, how many of your total cropped acres are tilled? [# acres, enter "0" if none]

name: farm_tillage_type
label: 18.a Clarification:  Do you consider your operation:

name: tillage_it_depends
label: 18. a1 Clarification: If you selected "it depends", please describe.

name: previous_tillage
label: 18.b Clarification: Have you ever tilled any of your cropped acres?

name: years_since_tillage
label: 18.c Clarification:  How many years since you last tilled any of your acres? [# of years]

name: tilled_acres_cover_crop
label: 19. How many of your COVER CROPPED acres are tilled? [# of acres, enter "0" if none]

name: tillage_type_cover_crop
label: 19.a What kind of tillage are you doing on the COVER CROPPED acres?

name: tillage_cover_crop_it_depends
label: 19. a1 Clarification: If you selected "it depends", please describe.

name: previous_tillage_cover_crop
label: 19.b Clarification: Have you ever tilled your COVER CROPPED acres?

name: years_since_tillage_cover_crop
label: 19.c Clarification: How many years since you last tilled your COVER CROPPED acres? [# of years]

name: info_sources
label: 20. What sources of information do you seek out and use to learn more about cover crops?

name: dst_use
label: 21. Do you use any decision support tools. (e.g, spreadsheets, worksheets, or software tools provided by NRCS, extension specialists, or crop advisors)?

name: software_use
label: 22. What types of software, if any, do you use to manage your farm data?

name: devices_use
label: 23. What type of devices do you use in your agricultural operations (iPad, computer, smartphone)?

name: yield_monitor
label: 24. Where do you store your yield monitor data?

name: yield_data_share
label: 25. Do you feel comfortable sharing yield monitor data?

name: percent_rented
label: 26. Approximately what percentage of the acres you farm are rented?

name: why_participating
label: 27. Why are you participating in this study?

name: generalfarmendnote
label: You've reached the end of the general farm questions. The next section refers to just the site (or sites) with the cover crop trial. Swipe left to the next screen to continue.

name: group_code_field_history
label: Group 3: PSA Site Specific Questions

name: site_specifics
label: The following questions pertain to the specific field(s) that your grower has in the trial. If the grower has multiple fields in trial, you will be prompted to enter information about each trial separately.

name: code
label: Trial code [3-letter code]

name: years_cover_crop
label: 28. How long has this site been cover cropped?

name: insured
label: 29. Is the trial field enrolled in crop insurance?

name: rent_own
label: 30. Is the trial field on rented or owned land?

name: code_crop_rotation
label: 31. What crops are GENERALLY in your crop rotation for this field?

name: previous_crop
label: 32. What was the previous crop last year in this field?

name: previous_fert
label: 33. How much total Nitrogen fertility was applied to the previous crop (approximately)? [lbs]

name: cover_crop_plant_date
label: 34. When was the COVER CROP planted?
hint: If an exact date is not known, please enter approximately, to the closest week or month.

name: cover_crop_planting_method
label: 35. How was the cover crop planted?

name: cover_crop_spp
label: 36. What cover crop species are planted?

name: cover_crop_rate_total
label: 37. What is the approximate total rate of all cover crop planted? (in lbs/ acre)

name: econ
label: 38. How much do you pay for cover crop seed?

name: econ_price_per_pound
label: 38 a1. Price per pound seed

name: econ_pounds_per_acre
label: 38 a2. Pounds of seed per acre

name: econ_price_per_load
label: 38 b1.Price per load

name: econ_load_per_field
label: 38 b2. Loads per field

name: econ_acres_per_field
label: 38 b3. Acres of that field

name: econ_price_seed_per_total_acres
label: 38 c1. Price of seed for total cover crop acres

name: econ_total_cover_acres
label: 38 c2. Total cover crop acres

name: econ_other
label: 38 d. How much do you pay for cover crop seed: Other

name: cover_crop_litter
label: 39. Do you apply litter, manure or fertility to your COVER CROP?
hint: Timeframe from cover crop planting to a month before crop planting.

name: cover_crop_tillage
label: 40. Do you do any tillage prior to terminating the COVER crop? (ie: subsoiling)

name: cover_crop_tillage_type
label: 40 a. If Yes, please describe?

name: cover_crop_termination
label: 41. How do you terminate your COVER crop?

name: cover_crop_termination_herbicide
label: 42. What herbicides do you plan to use?

name: How_much_money_do_yo_crops_in_this_field
label: 43. How much money do you plan to spend on herbicides to terminate cover crops in this field?

name: crop
label: 44. What is/ will be this year's crop?
hint: (*reminder* to participate in this trial, fields can only be planted in corn, soybean, or cotton)

name: crop_variety
label: 45. What is the variety of the crop?

name: crop_maturity
label: 46. What is the maturity of the crop? (ie, number of days to harvest or soybean maturity group, or other)

name: crop_tillage
label: 47. Will you do any type of tillage on this crop?
hint: Technicians: this trial uses only fields with conservation tillage practices, in which the surface residue of a cover crop remains intact. However some growers choose to preform some form of tillage, like strip tilling, or vertical tillage. It is important to record any soil disturbance for the water infiltration modeling team.

name: crop_tillage_type
label: 47 a. If yes, please describe tillage.

name: crop_fert
label: 48. How much total Nitrogen fertilizer will this year's crop receive? (if you already selected that the COVER CROP received litter or manure, do not add it again here)

name: more_farm_info
label: Are there other considerations or things you want us to know about this field? (why you plant cover crops there, it stays very wet, it's generally high biomass, it's new to cover crops, etc.)

name: notegroupselect
label: If this farm has more than 1 site/ trial for this grower, click the plus icon to add an additional site. A new group of questions will appear on the screen, above the +, so you will have to scroll back up.

name: note_end
label: Thank you for completing the Survey. Swipe to the next screen for a Timeline to share with your grower. Continue swiping until you reach the end to Submit.

name: note_to_farmer
label: TIMELINE -- a technician will be in contact this spring. Cover Crop biomass is collected in the spring at the time it is terminated.  For our safety it is nice to harvest biomass right before burndown. Please notify the technician when you think you will terminate, and we can harvest +/- 3 to 4 days around that time. We can also return following herbicide application, when safe to do so. We will return when the crop is planted.  When do you think that will be? How long after terminating the cover crop? It is important to record those dates. We will install moisture sensors in between the crop rows after it has emerged.  Please do all of your fertilizer applications, and other management operations the same as you always would in that field. Our equipment is designed to be sprayed over.  We will raise a solar panel after the crop has closed canopy. We will come take yield data by hand in a 10 foot section around the soil moisture sensors before you harvest with your combine. Please notify us when you will: terminate your cover crop, after crop planting, and before harvest.  Thank you.

name: note_to_tech
label: Technician: If there are questions that you were unable to complete at this time, you may save the survey to your device to retrieve later by clicking the arrow with the dot, selecting 'Go to End', naming the form by the farm name,  and select "Save Form and Exit". Forms can be retrieved in your "Saved Forms"
